page.title: 07RIDGEWAY PATH, RISBOROUGH
page.content: There are several ancient trackways in this area, the upper & lower icknield ways being the best known. In place they are still just footpaths and bridleway, but like many other ancient tracks, in parts they have become modernh highways. Several years ago, sketches of the upper icknield way and other lenghs of footpaths in the area become part of the ridgeway path, one of the modern long distance footpaths in britain. It runs from Ivinghoe Beacon in the east of the county of Aylesbury in Wiltshire. As its name implies, it follows the ridge of the Chilterns and other chalk downlands for much of the length. However it is foced to come down from its ridge to cross the many gaps which were probably breached in the Chilterns by meltwater at the end of the last ice age.
